fields.title: Cameroon - Guns for Motorbikes
fields.description:
In Cameroon’s Korup National Park, local communities have relied on the forest for centuries, including hunting wildlife for food. Legal and moral restrictions alone do not stop the practice, as it remains a key part of their daily lives.

During my filming trip, I joined NGOs working on sustainable forestry and wildlife management, aiming to balance conservation efforts with local needs. Learn about how in my film.

fields.title: Flying with the World’s Largest Plane: The Antonov An-225
fields.description:
The Antonov An-225 Mriya was the biggest aircraft ever built, designed in the Soviet Union, later flying for Ukrainian Antonov Airlines. I had the unique chance to fly on this engineering marvel in 2016, on its cargo mission from Prague in Czech Republic to Perth in Australia. Three days as the only woman on board for days with an all-male crew. What was it like inside? Watch the film! 

Tragically, this legendary plane was destroyed in Russia’s war against Ukraine, making my experience aboard even more meaningful.

fields.title: How Will We Energize the World of Tomorrow? My Inspiring Filming Trip to Malaysia
fields.description: As the global demand for sustainable energy solutions grows, the next generation of innovators is stepping up to the challenge. During my recent filming trip to Malaysia, I had the privilege of meeting impressive young entrepreneurs, visionary startup founders and changemakers who are shaping the future of energy in Malaysia.

fields.title: Indawgyi Lake, Myanmar – Eco-Tourism in the Making
fields.description:
Indawgyi Lake, Myanmar’s largest freshwater lake, is a place of natural beauty and cultural significance. On my filming trip, I met local communities working to develop eco-friendly tourism that protects the lake and supports sustainable livelihoods.

Balancing conservation and tourism is a challenge. How are people in the region approaching it? Learn about their efforts, hopes, and the impact on daily life.

fields.title: Seville - el personal best
fields.description: Running through the beautiful streets of Seville, I pushed my limits—and it paid off! 🏁 A fantastic race, perfect conditions, and an incredible atmosphere led me to a new personal best! Are you a runner, too? Let’s connect! Share your marathon goals, training tips, or race experiences, send me a message. Best via LinkedIn. I’d love to exchange ideas and motivation!

fields.title: Sicily, Italy – History, Culture, and Italian Atmosphere
fields.description: From ancient Greek temples to medieval towns and Baroque cities, Sicily is a place where history comes alive. Walking through its streets, I discovered a mix of cultures that have shaped the island for centuries. Beyond the landmarks, Sicily’s charm is: the scent of fresh espresso, and the warmth of Italian hospitality. Sicily offers a unique blend of past and present.

fields.title: Has Technology Become the New Religion?
fields.description:
We trust our smartphones, rely on AI, and follow algorithms—but have technologies become our modern-day faith? 
On my eye-opening journey to Taiwan, I met visionary innovators who see tech as a promise for a better future—and skeptics who warn of its hidden dangers. Who's right? And what does it mean for all of us?

fields.title: Mauna Kea, Hawaii – Where Earth Meets the Stars!
fields.description: At 4,207 meters, Mauna Kea in Hawaii is not just an epic challenge for hikers—it's also home to some of the world’s most advanced telescopes, unlocking the secrets of the universe. Reaching the summit was an unforgettable experience, with breathtaking views and a surreal feeling of standing at the edge of space. Have you hiked Mauna Kea or visited an observatory? Let’s connect and share our experiences!
